items.title: Fan Travel Accounts for 62% of Live Music-Related Carbon Emissions in theÂ U.S.:Â Study
items.summary: A new study by MIT, with support from Coldplay, Live Nation and more, assesses carbon emissions related to 80,000 live events in the U.S. and U.K.
items.body: A landmark report on carbon emissions in live music in the United States and the United Kingdom, released Thursday (Dec. 11) by MIT, found that fan travel to shows is the number one driver of those emissions in both territories. The study analyzed more than 80,000 live music events, from club shows to stadium tours, in the U.S. and U.K. to assess emissions related to trucking, energy, food and beverage consumption, water, waste, fan travel, artist and crew travel, accommodation, and freight related to live music. Related The 5 Biggest Music Sustainability Stories of 2024: Batteries, Reusable Cups, Extreme Heat & More Universal Music Group Opens UMusic Shops In New York, London After 'Sand in My Boots' Rebrand This Year, Hangout Music Festival Won't Return in 2026 The study found that in the U.K., fan travel created 77% of emissions in live music, with that number falling to 62% in the U.S., across nearly all show sizes, from one-off shows and club tours to local tours and stadium shows. These results are consistent with previous reports that have found that flights, car rides and other carbon-emitting forms of travel to shows are the biggest contributors toâ€¦

items.body: Tate McRae has reflected on her split from The Kid LAROI and the intense public scrutiny that came with the relationship, her first in the spotlight as an A-list pop star. In the accompanying interview, the Canadian singer detailed how the speculation and public picking apart of her relationship with LAROI became “really scary” and “overwhelming.” Related How Did ‘Tit for Tat’ Become Tate McRae’s Best-Debuting Song as a Lead Artist? items.title: Alex Warren, NF Break Through on November 2025 Top Gabb Music SongsÂ Chart
items.summary: â€œOrdinaryâ€ spends its first week at No. 1, while NF has eight of the rankingâ€™s 25 positions.
items.body: After four months of KPop Demon Hunters at No. 1 on the Top Gabb Music Songs chart, the monthly ranking has two new stars for November 2025: Alex Warren and NF . Warren’s “Ordinary” is the tallyâ€™s latest No. 1, while NF boasts eight entries on the 25-position chart, the most of any artist at one time since its inception. Billboard has partnered with Gabb Wireless, a phone company for kids and teens, to present a monthly chart tracking on-demand streams via its Gabb Music platform. Gabb Music offers a vast catalog of songs, all of which are selected by the Gabb team to include only kid- and teen-appropriate content. Gabb Music streams are not currently factored into any other Billboard charts. First, â€œOrdinary.â€ The song debuted on the weekly Billboard Hot 100 in February and began a 10-week run at No. 1 in June, and it first appeared on Top Gabb Music Songs in April, rising to No. 2 in June â€” the month before the KPop Demon Hunters dominance on the list began. But in November, the songs from the Netflix filmâ€™s soundtrack have finally begun falling â€” and taking their place is the song thatâ€™s been the top non- KPop Demon Hunters song over the past four months, â€œOrdâ€¦

items.title: Rod Wave Hit With Lawsuit by Photographer Over Album Cover Image: â€˜Utter Disregardâ€™
items.summary: Allan Salas says he was never paid for the use of the photo even after the rapper's reps were warned that he owned it.
items.body: Rod Wave is facing a lawsuit claiming he stole the photo featured on the cover of his 2024 album Last Lap from a Florida photographer who snapped it at a concert. In a complaint filed Thursday (Dec. 11), Allan Salas says he was never paid for the use of his image â€” a shot of Rod holding a mic stand at a Tampa, Fla., concert â€” even after the rapperâ€™s reps were expressly warned that Salas owned it. Related Rod Wave Countersues After $27M Tour Lawsuit: Promoter Is Trying to Force â€˜Indentured Servitudeâ€™ Universal Music Group Opens UMusic Shops In New York, London After 'Sand in My Boots' Rebrand This Year, Hangout Music Festival Won't Return in 2026 Not only did the star use the image on the album, Salas claims â€” he also used it to promote his 28-show arena tour and on merch like t-shirts. â€œEven though the defendants had already commercially released the album, which contained unauthorized uses of the photograph, the defendants doubled down and tripled down on their unauthorized use,â€ his attorneys wrote in the lawsuit, obtained by Billboard . Waveâ€™s Last Lap debuted at No. 2 on the Billboard 200 in October 2024 and ultimately spent 56 weeks on the album chart, marâ€¦

items.title: Bowen Yang Reveals What Ariana Grande Taught Him â€˜About Overcoming Thingsâ€™ While Shooting â€˜Wickedâ€™
items.summary: The Saturday Night Live star also confirmed that there is a Wicked cast group chat.
items.body: One thing’s for certain, filming the Wicked movies has changed Bowen Yang “for good.” Related Therapy, Meds and Visits to the Beach: Comeback Kid Lewis Capaldi Talks Lifestyle Changes Taylor Swift Asked to Name Her Five Favorite TayTay Songs on 'Colbert': Watch Taylor Swift Says 'Hey Stephen' to Colbert in Cute Backstage Video Ahead of 'Late Show' Visit In a new Esquire interview (Dec. 10), the Emmy-nominated Saturday Night Live reflected on what his co-star Ariana Grande taught him during filming the box office-dominating movies. “Iâ€™ve learned so many things from Ariana Grande,” he gushed. “Iâ€™ve learned about overcoming things. I lost a sense of myself while we were shooting  Wicked  because it was just the back-to-back work of doing  SNL  and then going to London for  Wicked  and then doing  SNL  again and going to London. It really unmoored me. And Ari very gently brought me back to shore.” Yang stars as Pfannee, a syncophantic friend to Grande’s “Glinda” in the Wicked films. The first film hit theatres last fall, grossing over $750 million at tâ€¦

items.body: In an emotional interview, Jelly Roll opened up about the many reasons he felt motivated to lose weight â€” and one of the most predominant ones, he revealed, was to improve his intimacy with wife Bunnie Xo. Related Jelly Roll Shows Off Weight Loss & Meets Pope Leo XIV in Rome: ‘From Rock Bottom to Holy Ground’ Jelly Roll Invited to Become Grand Ole Opry Member: ‘It Don’t Get No Bigger in Country Music’ Jelly Roll & Bunnie Xo Go to Prom for the First Time Ever, Thanks to 17-Year-Old Daughter: ‘She Crowned Us King & Queen’ While speaking to Joe Rogan in a podcast episode posted Wednesday (Dec. 10), the country star teared up while discussing how his food addiction and struggles with obesity had strained his relationships with his family. “I’d done nothing but lie to them for years about this weight,” he began, his voice breaking. “I’d never proved to them that I was gonna change.” “I realized then how much my addiction had been hurting this family,” he continued of the start of his weight-loss journey, through which he’s shed nearly 300 pounds. “How much myâ€¦

items.title: 10 Essential Music Books That Also Make GreatÂ Gifts
items.summary: They'll start flipping through these biographies, autobiographies and memoirs long before all the presents have been unwrapped.
items.body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Books always make great gifts – and music books are especially good, since it’s easier to guess someone’s taste in music than in novels. The past few years have been a booming time for rock books, including biographies and autobiographies, and some great titles came out in 2025, from memoirs by Patti Smith and Robbie Robertson , to biographies ( Talking Heads ) and oral histories (Wings ). They all go nicely with the music that inspired them. Check out our favorite music books worthy of a placement underneath the Christmas tree. Tonight in Jungleland: The Making of Born to Run By Peter Ames Carlin Some rock icons loom so large that books about them are getting smaller – first a book about Bruce Springsteen’s Nebraska (which was adapted into Deliver Me from Nowhere ), now one about Born to Run . Fans know the basic arc: Careerwise, Springsteen had one last chance to make it real, so he labored over the album that became â€¦

items.summary: The Argentine star is Billboard's Latin Artist on the Rise in December.
items.body: Milo J was on a two-month vacation with his dad when puberty struck and caused his voice to deepen. He was 14 years old. Now, itâ€™s that same voiceâ€”profound, calm, mature, and flooded with sensitivityâ€”that has made him a household name in the Latin music realm.  Related Bad Bunny and His Mexico City Fans ‘Set the Bar High’ in First Night of Eight-Show Run The Year in Charts: Here Are Billboardâ€™s Top 5 New Latin Artists of 2025 Watch Danny Ocean Sing at the Nobel Peace Prize Ceremony Honoring Venezuela’s MarÃ­a Corina Machado â€œI didn’t have the opportunity to take music or singing lessons. It was very intuitive, really; it was mostly just singing on my own,â€ he tells Billboard, while also crediting his older sister. â€œMy passion for music started because of her. She rapped, she freestyled, she wrote songs, and I wanted to do the same. My sister did it more as a hobby, but I made it my career.â€  Inspired by artists such as WOS, RosalÃ­a, Tyga, and Kanye West, Milo (real name: Camilo JoaquÃ­n Villarruel) began freestyling in his native MorÃ³n, a city located in the greater Buenos Aires metropolitan area. items.title: Lizzo Dancers Push for Trial in Sex Harassment Case: Banana Incident Was Not â€˜CreativeÂ Expressionâ€™
items.summary: A lawyer for Lizzo's ex-dancers says under her reading of the First Amendment, Johnny Cash would be free to shoot â€œa man in Reno just to watch him die.â€
items.body: Lizzo â€™s former backup dancers are urging an appeals court to reject the superstarâ€™s free speech arguments and allow their blockbuster sexual harassment lawsuit to go to trial. A Los Angeles judge ruled at the start of 2024 that three dancers on Lizzoâ€™s Special tour can move forward with some of their legal claims against the star (Melissa Jefferson). While the judge dismissed a headline-grabbing claim about fat-shaming, he said there should be a trial on equally salacious allegations that Lizzo pushed her staff to touch nude performers and eat bananas out of their genitals while attending sex shows in Amsterdam and Paris. Related The 10 Biggest Music Law Stories of 2025: AI, Diddy, Drake, Mariah Carey & More Universal Music Group Opens UMusic Shops In New York, London After 'Sand in My Boots' Rebrand This Year, Hangout Music Festival Won't Return in 2026 Lizzoâ€™s lawyers are appealing that decision , arguing over the summer that group outings were part of the singerâ€™s creative process and thus should be shielded by First Amendment free speech protections. But in a Monday (Dec. 8) response brief, obtained by Billboard , an attorney for the dancers says thereâ€¦

items.title: Grand Slam Track files for bankruptcy to 'reorganise'
items.summary: Olympic great Michael Johnson says he will "refuse to give up on the mission of Grand Slam Track" after the athletics competition he backed files for bankruptcy following months of financial difficulty.

items.title: Barcelona 'not a pressure' for on-loan Rashford
items.summary: Marcus Rashford says he finds nothing at Barcelona "a pressure" and is at the club to "enjoy myself" as he continues to thrive since his move from Manchester United.

items.title: I'm learning a new football language - Rashford

items.title: 'It felt like God's hand on my brain' - the day England were humbled by teenager
items.summary: BBC Sport's From The Ashes series concludes with the inside story of Ashton Agar's record-breaking introduction to Test cricket as a 19-year-old batting at number 11.

items.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
items.summary: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.
